questions.subject: Pakistan Studies
questions.question: Who is known as the founder of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah is known as the founder of Pakistan. He led the All-India Muslim League and the Pakistan Movement.

questions.subject: Pakistan Studies
questions.question: What is the capital of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Islamabad is the capital of Pakistan. It was built in the 1960s to replace Karachi as the capital.

questions.subject: Pakistan Studies
questions.question: When was the current Constitution of Pakistan adopted?
questions.explanation: The current Constitution of Pakistan was adopted on April 14, 1973. It is the third constitution of Pakistan.

questions.subject: Pakistan Studies
questions.question: Which is the longest river in Pakistan?
questions.explanation: The Indus River is the longest river in Pakistan, flowing approximately 3,180 km through the country.

questions.subject: Pakistan Studies
questions.question: In which city was the Pakistan Resolution passed in 1940?
questions.explanation: The Pakistan Resolution (Lahore Resolution) was passed on March 23, 1940, in Lahore at the annual session of the All-India Muslim League.
